intro: Alvaradoa subovata var. puberulenta, commonly known as the pubescent subovate alvaradoa, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its subovate (egg-shaped) leaves and hairy (pubescent) surface, giving it a distinctive texture. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
